Account.AccountNumber: Account number assigned to this account (not the unique, system-generated ID assigned during creation).
Account.AccountSource: The source of the account record.
Account.AnnualRevenue: Estimated annual revenue of the account. This is NOT OUR REVENUE made with the account! Do not use this field unless you explicitly need to use the amount of money the account makes as a business for themselves.
Account.BillingAddress: The compound form of the billing address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.
Account.BillingCity: City name of the billing address of this account.
Account.BillingCountry: Country name the billing address of this account.
Account.BillingGeocodeAccuracy: Accuracy level of the geocode for the billing address.
Account.BillingLatitude: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.
Account.BillingLongitude: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.
Account.BillingPostalCode: Postal code of the billing address of this account.
Account.BillingState: State name of the billing address of this account.
Account.BillingStreet: Street address for the billing address of this account.
Account.Industry: An industry associated with this account.
Account.Jigsaw: References the ID of a company in Data.com. If an account has a value in this field, it means that the account was imported from Data.com. If the field value is null, the account was not imported from Data.com. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts.
Account.LastActivityDate: Value is one of the following, whichever is the most recent: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.
Account.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Account.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Account.MasterRecordId: If this object was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that was kept. If this object was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null.
Account.Name: Name of the account. If the account has a record type of Person Account: This value is the concatenation of the FirstName, MiddleName, LastName, and Suffix of the associated person contact.
Account.NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees working at the company represented by this account.
Account.OwnerId: The ID of the user who currently owns this account. Default value is the user logged in to the API to perform the create.
Account.ParentId: ID of the parent object, if any.
Account.PhotoUrl: Path to be combined with the URL of a Salesforce instance (for example, https://yourInstance.salesforce.com/) to generate a URL to request the social network profile image associated with the account.
Account.Rating: The account’s prospect rating, for example Hot, Warm, or Cold.
Account.RecordTypeId: ID of the record type assigned to this object.
Account.ShippingAddress: The compound form of the shipping address.
Account.ShippingCity: City name of the shipping address for this account.
Account.ShippingCountry: Country name of the shipping address for this account.
Account.ShippingGeocodeAccuracy: Accuracy level of the geocode for the shipping address.
Account.ShippingLatitude: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address.
Account.ShippingLongitude: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
Account.ShippingPostalCode: Postal code of the shipping address for this account.
Account.ShippingState: State name of the shipping address for this account.
Account.ShippingStreet: The street address of the shipping address for this account.
Account.SicDesc: A brief description of an org’s line of business, based on its SIC code. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts.
Account.Site: Account side name of the account’s location, for example Headquarters or London.
Account.Type: Type and/or subtype of account, for example, Customer, Competitor, or Partner. It may have multiple semantically close subtypes of the same type, for example `Customer`, `Customer - Direct`, `Customer - Channel`, etc.

Address.Description: A brief description of the address.
Address.GeocodeAccuracy: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address.
Address.Latitude: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address.
Address.Longitude: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address.
Address.Name: An auto-generated number identifying the address.
Address.ParentId: A lookup field to the parent location.

Asset.AccountId: (Required) ID of the Account associated with this asset. Must be a valid account ID. Required if ContactId isn’t specified.
Asset.AssetLevel: The asset’s position in an asset hierarchy. If the asset has no parent or child assets, its level is 1. Assets that belong to a hierarchy have a level of 1 for the root asset, 2 for the child assets of the root asset, 3 for their children, and so forth.On assets created before the introduction of this field, the asset level defaults to –1. After the asset record is updated, the asset level is calculated and automatically updated.
Asset.AssetProvidedById: The account that provided the asset, typically a manufacturer.
Asset.AssetServicedById: The account in charge of servicing the asset.
Asset.ContactId: Required if AccountId isn’t specified. ID of the Contact associated with this asset. Must be a valid contact ID that has an account parent (but doesn’t need to match the asset’s AccountId).
Asset.InstallDate: Date when the asset was installed.
Asset.IsCompetitorProduct: Indicates whether this Asset represents a product sold by a competitor (true) or not (false). Default value is false. Its UI label is Competitor Asset.
Asset.IsInternal: Indicates that the asset is produced or used internally (true) or not (false). Default value is false. Its UI label is Internal Asset.
Asset.LastReferencedDate: The date and time that the asset was last modified. Its UI label is Last Modified Date.
Asset.LastViewedDate: The date and time that the asset was last viewed.
Asset.Name: (Required) Name of the asset. Label is Asset Name.
Asset.OwnerId: The asset’s owner. By default, the asset owner is the user who created the asset record. Its UI label is Asset Owner.
Asset.ParentId: The asset’s parent asset. Its UI label is Parent Asset.
Asset.Product2Id: (Optional) ID of the Product2 associated with this asset. Must be a valid Product2 ID. Its UI label is Product.
Asset.ProductCode: The product code of the related product.
Asset.PurchaseDate: Date on which this asset was purchased.
Asset.RootAssetId: The top-level asset in an asset hierarchy. Depending on where an asset lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent. Its UI label is Root Asset.
Asset.StockKeepingUnit: The SKU assigned to the related product.
Asset.TotalLifecycleAmount: The total amount of revenue for the asset, including revenue from each stage in the asset lifecycle.
Asset.UsageEndDate: Date when usage for this asset ends or expires.

Campaign.ActualCost: Amount of money spent to run the campaign.
Campaign.AmountAllOpportunities: Amount of money in all opportunities associated with the campaign, including closed/won opportunities.
Campaign.AmountWonOpportunities: Amount of money in closed or won opportunities associated with the campaign.
Campaign.BudgetedCost: Amount of money budgeted for the campaign.
Campaign.CampaignMemberRecordTypeId: The record type ID for CampaignMember records associated with the campaign.
Campaign.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.
Campaign.EndDate: Ending date for the campaign. Responses received after this date are still counted.
Campaign.ExpectedResponse: Percentage of responses you expect to receive for the campaign.
Campaign.ExpectedRevenue: Amount of money you expect to generate from the campaign.
Campaign.IsActive: Indicates whether this campaign is active (true) or not (false). Default value is false.
Campaign.LastActivityDate: Value is one of the following, whichever is the most recent: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.
Campaign.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Campaign.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Campaign.Name: Name of the campaign.
Campaign.NumberOfContacts: Number of contacts associated with the campaign.
Campaign.NumberOfConvertedLeads: Number of leads that were converted to an account and contact due to the marketing efforts in the campaign.
Campaign.NumberOfLeads: Number of leads associated with the campaign. Label is Leads in Campaign.
Campaign.NumberOfOpportunities: Number of opportunities associated with the campaign. Label is Opportunities in Campaign.
Campaign.NumberOfResponses: Number of contacts and unconverted leads with a Member Status equivalent to “Responded” for the campaign.
Campaign.NumberOfWonOpportunities: Number of closed or won opportunities associated with the campaign.
Campaign.NumberSent: Number of individuals targeted by the campaign. For example, the number of emails sent
Campaign.OwnerId: ID of the user who owns this campaign. Default value is the user logging in to the API to perform the create.
Campaign.ParentId: ID of the parent Campaign record, if any.
Campaign.RecordTypeId: ID of the record type assigned to this object.
Campaign.Status: Status of the campaign, for example, Planned, In Progress.
Campaign.Type: Type of campaign, for example, Direct Mail or Referral Program.

CampaignMember.CampaignId: ID of the Campaign to which this Lead or Contact is associated.
CampaignMember.City: The city for the address of the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.CompanyOrAccount: The company or account of the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.ContactId: ID of the Contact who is associated with a Campaign.
CampaignMember.Country: The country for the address of the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.
CampaignMember.Description: The description of the associated lead or contact.
CampaignMember.DoNotCall: Indicates that the contact does not wish to be called.
CampaignMember.Email: Email address for the contact or lead.
CampaignMember.Fax: Fax number for the contact or lead.
CampaignMember.FirstName: The first name of the contact or lead.
CampaignMember.FirstRespondedDate: Indicates the date on which the campaign member was first given a responded status.
CampaignMember.HasOptedOutOfEmail: Indicates whether the contact or lead would prefer not to receive email from Salesforce (true) or not (false).
CampaignMember.HasOptedOutOfFax: Indicates that the contact or lead does not wish to receive faxes.
CampaignMember.HasResponded: Indicates whether the campaign member has responded to the campaign (true) or not (false). Label is Responded.
CampaignMember.LastName: The last name of the contact or lead.
CampaignMember.LeadId: ID of the Lead who is associated with a Campaign.
CampaignMember.LeadOrContactId: The ID of the associated lead or contact.
CampaignMember.LeadOrContactOwnerId: The ID of the owner of the associated lead or contact.
CampaignMember.LeadSource: The source from which the lead was obtained.
CampaignMember.MobilePhone: The mobile phone number of the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.Name: First and last name of the contact or lead with which the campaign member is associated.
CampaignMember.Phone: The phone number of the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.PostalCode: The postal code of the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.Salutation: Salutation for the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.State: The state for the address of the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.Status: Controls the HasResponded flag on this object. You can't directly set the HasResponded flag, as it is read-only. You can set it indirectly by setting this field in a create or update call. Each predefined value implies a HasResponded flag value. Each time you update this field, you implicitly update the HasResponded flag. In the Salesforce user interface, Marketing users can define valid status values for the Status picklist. They can choose one status as the default status. For each Status field value, they can also select which values to count as “Responded,” meaning that the HasResponded flag is set to true for those values.
CampaignMember.Street: The street for the address of the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.Title: Title for the lead or contact.
CampaignMember.Type: Indicates whether the campaign member is a lead or a contact.

Case.AccountId: ID of the account associated with this case.
Case.CaseNumber: Assigned automatically when each case is inserted. It can't be set directly, and it can't be modified after the case is created.
Case.ClosedDate: The date and time when the case was closed.
Case.Comments: Used to insert a new CaseComment.
Case.ContactEmail: Email address for the contact. The Case.ContactEmail field displays the Email field on the contact that is referenced by Case.ContactId. Label is Contact Email.
Case.ContactFax: Fax number for the contact. Label is Contact Fax.
Case.ContactMobile: Mobile telephone number for the contact. Label is Contact Mobile.
Case.ContactPhone: Telephone number for the contact. Label is Contact Phone.
Case.Description: A text description of the case.
Case.IsClosed: Indicates whether the case is closed (true) or open (false). This field is controlled by the Status field; it can't be set directly. Label is Closed.
Case.IsEscalated: Indicates whether the case has been escalated (true) or not. A case's escalated state does not affect how you can use a case, or whether you can query, delete, or update it. Label is Escalated.
Case.Language: The language of the case. This field is available in all Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited orgs with the Service Cloud. Out of the box, it's used only by Einstein Case Classification.
Case.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Case.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Case.MasterRecordId: If this object was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that was kept. If this object was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null.
Case.Origin: The source of the case, such as Email, Phone, or Web. Label is Case Origin.
Case.OwnerId: ID of the contact who owns the case.
Case.ParentId: The ID of the parent case in the hierarchy. The label is Parent Case.
Case.Priority: The importance or urgency of the case, such as High, Medium, or Low.
Case.Reason: The reason why the case was created, such as Instructions not clear, or User didn’t attend training.
Case.RecordTypeId: ID of the record type assigned to this object.
Case.SlaStartDate: Shows the time that the case entered an entitlement process. If you have the Edit permission on cases, you can update or reset the time.
Case.Status: The status of the case, such as New, Closed, or Escalated. This field directly controls the IsClosed flag. Each predefined Status value implies an IsClosed flag value. For more information, see CaseStatus.
Case.Subject: The subject of the case.
Case.SuppliedCompany: The company name that was entered when the case was created. Label is Company.
Case.SuppliedEmail: The email address that was entered when the case was created. Label is Email. If no email address is in the contact record, the email specified here is used.
Case.SuppliedName: The name that was entered when the case was created. Label is Name.
Case.SuppliedPhone: The phone number that was entered when the case was created. Label is Phone.
Case.Type: The type of case, such as Feature Request or Question.

CaseComment.CommentBody: Text of the CaseComment. Label is Body.
CaseComment.IsPublished: Indicates whether the CaseComment is visible to customers in the Self-Service portal (true) or not (false). Label is Published.
CaseComment.ParentId: ID of the parent Case of the CaseComment.

CaseHistory.CaseId: ID of the Case associated with this record.
CaseHistory.Field: Name of the case field that was modified, or a special value to indicate some other modification to the case.
CaseHistory.NewValue: New value of the modified case field.
CaseHistory.OldValue: Previous value of the modified case field.

CaseMilestone.BusinessHoursId: ID of the BusinessHours associated with the CaseMilestone.
CaseMilestone.CompletionDate: The date and time the milestone was completed.
CaseMilestone.ElapsedTimeInDays: The time required to complete a milestone in days.
CaseMilestone.ElapsedTimeInHrs: The time required to complete a milestone in hours.
CaseMilestone.ElapsedTimeInMins: The time required to complete a milestone in minutes.
CaseMilestone.IsCompleted: Indicates whether the milestone is completed (true) or not (false).
CaseMilestone.IsViolated: Indicates whether the milestone is violated (true) or not (false).
CaseMilestone.MilestoneTypeId: The ID of the milestone on the case.
CaseMilestone.StartDate: The date and time the milestone started on the case.
CaseMilestone.TargetDate: The date and time the milestone must be completed.
CaseMilestone.TargetResponseInDays: The time to complete the milestone in days.
CaseMilestone.TargetResponseInHrs: The time to complete the milestone in hours.
CaseMilestone.TargetResponseInMins: The time to complete the milestone in minutes.
CaseMilestone.TimeRemainingInDays: Time remaining to reach the milestone target, measured in days.
CaseMilestone.TimeRemainingInHrs: Time remaining to reach the milestone target, measured in hours.
CaseMilestone.TimeRemainingInMins: Time remaining to reach the milestone target. The format is minutes and seconds.
CaseMilestone.TimeSinceTargetInDays: The time elapsed since the milestone target, measured in days.
CaseMilestone.TimeSinceTargetInHrs: The time elapsed since the milestone target, measured in hours.
CaseMilestone.TimeSinceTargetInMins: The time elapsed since the milestone target. The format is minutes and seconds.

Contact.AccountId: ID of the account that’s the parent of this contact.
Contact.Description: A description of the contact. Label is Contact Description.
Contact.EmailBouncedDate: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the contact bounces, the date and time of the bounce.
Contact.EmailBouncedReason: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the contact bounces, the reason for the bounce.
Contact.Fax: The contact’s fax number. Label is Business Fax.
Contact.IndividualId: ID of the data privacy record associated with this contact. This field is available if Data Protection and Privacy is enabled.
Contact.IsEmailBounced: If bounce management is activated and an email is sent to a contact, indicates whether the email bounced (true) or not (false).
Contact.Jigsaw: References the company’s ID in Data.com. If an account has a value in this field, it means that the account was imported from Data.com. If the field value is null, the account was not imported from Data.com.
Contact.LastActivityDate: Value is the most recent of either: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.
Contact.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Contact.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Contact.MailingAddress: The compound form of the mailing address.
Contact.MailingGeocodeAccuracy: Accuracy level of the geocode for the mailing address.
Contact.MailingLatitude: Used with MailingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a mailing address.
Contact.MailingLongitude: Used with MailingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a mailing address.
Contact.MasterRecordId: If this record was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that remains. If this record was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null.
Contact.Name: Concatenation of FirstName, MiddleName, LastName, and Suffix.
Contact.OtherAddress: The compound form of the other address.
Contact.OtherGeocodeAccuracy: Accuracy level of the geocode for the other address.
Contact.OtherLatitude: Used with OtherLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of an alternate address.
Contact.OtherLongitude: Used with OtherLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an alternate address.
Contact.OwnerId: The ID of the owner of the account associated with this contact.
Contact.Phone: Telephone number for the contact. Label is Business Phone.
Contact.PhotoUrl: Path to be combined with the URL of a Salesforce instance (Example: https://yourInstance.salesforce.com/) to generate a URL to request the social network profile image associated with the contact.
Contact.RecordTypeId: ID of the record type assigned to this object.
Contact.ReportsToId: This field doesn’t appear if IsPersonAccount is true.
Contact.Salutation: Honorific abbreviation, word, or phrase to be used in front of name in greetings, such as Dr. or Mrs.
Contact.Title: Title of the contact, such as CEO or Vice President.

Contract.AccountId: ID of the Account associated with this contract.
Contract.ActivatedById: ID of the User who activated this contract.
Contract.ActivatedDate: Date and time when this contract was activated.
Contract.BillingAddress: The compound form of the billing address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.
Contract.BillingCountry: Details for the billing address of this account.
Contract.BillingGeocodeAccuracy: The accuracy of the geocode for the billing address.
Contract.BillingLatitude: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.
Contract.BillingLongitude: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.
Contract.BillingPostalCode: Details for the billing address of this account.
Contract.BillingStreet: Street address for the billing address.
Contract.CompanySignedDate: Date on which the contract was signed by your organization.
Contract.CompanySignedId: ID of the User who signed the contract.
Contract.ContractTerm: Number of months that the contract is valid.
Contract.CustomerSignedDate: Date on which the customer signed the contract.
Contract.CustomerSignedId: ID of the Contact who signed this contract.
Contract.CustomerSignedTitle: Title of the customer who signed the contract.
Contract.EndDate: Calculated end date of the contract. This value is calculated by adding the ContractTerm to the StartDate.
Contract.LastActivityDate: Value is one of the following, whichever is the most recent: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.
Contract.LastApprovedDate: Last date the contract was approved.
Contract.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Contract.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Contract.OwnerExpirationNotice: Number of days ahead of the contract end date (15, 30, 45, 60, 90, and 120). Used to notify the owner in advance that the contract is ending.
Contract.OwnerId: ID of the user who owns the contract.
Contract.ShippingAddress: The compound form of the shipping address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.
Contract.ShippingCity: City name of the shipping address.
Contract.ShippingLatitude: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address.
Contract.ShippingLongitude: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
Contract.ShippingPostalCode: Postal code of the shipping address.
Contract.ShippingState: State name of the shipping address.
Contract.ShippingStreet: The street address of the shipping address.
Contract.SpecialTerms: Special terms that apply to the contract.
Contract.StartDate: Start date for this contract. Label is Contract Start Date.
Contract.Status: The picklist of values that indicate order status. Each value is within one of two status categories defined in StatusCode. For example, the status picklist may contain: Ready to Ship, Shipped, Received as values within the Activated StatusCode.
Contract.StatusCode: The status category for the contract. A contract can be Draft, InApproval, or Activated. Label is Status Category.

ContractLineItem.AssetId: ID of the Asset associated with the contract line item. Must be a valid asset ID.
ContractLineItem.Description: Description of the contract line item.
ContractLineItem.Discount: The discount for the product as a percentage.
ContractLineItem.EndDate: The last day the contract line item is in effect.
ContractLineItem.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
ContractLineItem.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
ContractLineItem.LineItemNumber: Automatically-generated number that identifies the contract line item.
ContractLineItem.ListPrice: Corresponds to the UnitPrice on the PricebookEntry that is associated with this line item, which can be in the standard pricebook or a custom pricebook. A client application can use this information to show whether the unit price (or sales price) of the line item differs from the pricebook entry list price.
ContractLineItem.LocationId: The location associated with the contract line item.
ContractLineItem.ParentContractLineItemId: The line item’s parent line item, if it has one.
ContractLineItem.Product2Id: The product related to the contract line item.
ContractLineItem.Quantity: Number of units of the contract line item (product) included in the associated service contract.
ContractLineItem.RootContractLineItemId: The top-level line item in a contract line item hierarchy. Depending on where a line item lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent.
ContractLineItem.ServiceContractId: ID of the ServiceContract associated with the contract line item. Must be a valid asset ID.
ContractLineItem.StartDate: The first day the contract line item is in effect.
ContractLineItem.Status: Status of the contract line item.
ContractLineItem.Subtotal: Contract line item's sales price multiplied by the Quantity.
ContractLineItem.TotalPrice: This field is available only for backward compatibility. It represents the total price of the ContractLineItem
ContractLineItem.UnitPrice: The unit price for the contract line item. In the user interface, this field’s value is calculated by dividing the total price of the contract line item by the quantity listed for that line item. Label is Sales Price.

CurrencyType.ConversionRate: Conversion rate of this currency type against the corporate currency.
CurrencyType.DecimalPlaces: For this currency, specifies the number of digits to the right of the decimal point, such as zero (0) for JPY or 2 for USD.
CurrencyType.IsActive: Indicates whether this currency type is active (true) or not (false). Inactive currency types do not appear in picklists in the user interface. Label is Active. This field defaults to false if no value is provided when updating or inserting a record.
CurrencyType.IsCorporate: Indicates whether this currency type is the corporate currency (true) or not (false). Label is Corporate Currency. All other currency conversion rates are applied against this corporate currency. If a currency is already defined as the corporate currency in the user interface, it can't be unset. When a non-corporate currency is set to a corporate currency, the system reconfigures all conversion rates based on the new corporate currency.
CurrencyType.IsoCode: ISO code of the currency. Must be one of the valid alphabetic, three-letter currency ISO codes defined by the ISO 4217 standard, such as USD, GBP, or JPY. Must be unique within your organization. Label is Currency ISO Code.

DatedConversionRate.ConversionRate: Conversion rate of this currency type against the corporate currency.
DatedConversionRate.IsoCode: ISO code of the currency. Must be one of the valid alphabetic, three-letter currency ISO codes defined by the ISO 4217 standard, such as USD, GBP, or JPY. Must be unique within your organization. Label is Currency ISO Code.
DatedConversionRate.NextStartDate: Read only. The date on which the next effective dated exchange rate will start. Effectively the day after the end date for this exchange rate.
DatedConversionRate.StartDate: The date on which the effective dated exchange rate starts.

Document.AuthorId: ID of the User who is responsible for the Document.
Document.Body: Encoded file data. If specified, then do not specify a URL.
Document.ContentType: Type of content. Label is Mime Type.
Document.DeveloperName: The unique name of the object in the API. Label is Document Unique Name.
Document.FolderId: ID of the Folder that contains the document.
Document.IsBodySearchable: Indicates whether the contents of the object can be searched using a SOSL FIND call. The ALL FIELDS search group includes the content as a searchable field.
Document.IsInternalUseOnly: Indicates whether the object is only available for internal use (true) or not (false). Label is Internal Use Only.
Document.IsPublic: Indicates whether the object is available for external use (true) or not (false). Label is Externally Available.
Document.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.
Document.LastViewedDate: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.
Document.Name: Name of the document. Label is Document Name.
Document.Type: File type of the Document. In general, the values match the file extension for the type of Document (such as pdf or jpg). Label is File Extension.
Document.Url: URL reference to the file (instead of storing it in the database). If specified, do not specify the Body or BodyLength.

Event.AccountId: Represents the ID of the related account. The AccountId is determined as follows. If the value of WhatId is any of the following objects, then Salesforce uses that object’s AccountId. Account Opportunity Contract Custom object that is a child of Account If the value of the WhatId field is any other object, and the value of the WhoId field is a contact object, then Salesforce uses that contact’s AccountId. (If your org uses Shared Activities, Salesforce uses the AccountId of the primary contact.) Otherwise, Salesforce sets the value of the AccountId field to null.
Event.ActivityDate: Contains the event’s due date if the IsAllDayEvent flag is set to true. This field is a date field with a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Don’t attempt to alter the timestamp to account for time zone differences. Label is Due Date Only. The value for this field and StartDateTime must match, or one of them must be null.
Event.ActivityDateTime: Contains the event’s due date if the IsAllDayEvent flag is set to false. The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. Label is Due Date Time. The value for this field and StartDateTime must match, or one of them must be null.
Event.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.
Event.Description: Contains a text description of the event.
Event.DurationInMinutes: Contains the event length, in minutes. Even though this field represents a temporal value, it is an integer type—not a Date/Time type.
Event.EndDate: This field supplies the date value that appears in the EndDateTime field. This field is a date field with a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone.
Event.EndDateTime: The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. This field is optional, depending on the following: If IsAllDayEvent is true, you can supply a value for either DurationInMinutes or EndDateTime. Supplying values in both fields is allowed if the values add up to the same amount of time. If both fields are null, the duration defaults to one day. If IsAllDayEvent is false, a value must be supplied for either DurationInMinutes or EndDateTime. Supplying values in both fields is allowed if the values add up to the same amount of time.Depending on your API version, errors with the DurationInMinutes and EndDateTime fields may appear in different places.
Event.EventSubtype: Provides standard subtypes to facilitate creating and searching for events.
Event.IsAllDayEvent: Indicates whether the ActivityDate field (true) or the ActivityDateTime field (false) is used to define the date or time of the event. Label is All-Day Event. See also DurationInMinutes and EndDateTime.
Event.IsArchived: Indicates whether the event has been archived.
Event.IsChild: Indicates whether the event is a child of another event (true) or not (false).
Event.IsGroupEvent: Indicates whether the event is a group event—that is, whether it has invitees (true) or not (false).
Event.IsPrivate: Indicates whether users other than the creator of the event can (false) or can’t (true) see the event details when viewing the event user’s calendar. Label is Private.
Event.IsRecurrence: Indicates whether a Salesforce Classic event is scheduled to repeat itself (true) or only occurs once (false). Label is Create recurring series of events.
Event.IsRecurrence2: Indicates whether a Lightning Experience event is scheduled to repeat (true) or only occurs once (false. If this field value is true, then Recurrence2PatternText and Recurrence2PatternVersion must be populated. Label is Repeat.
Event.IsRecurrence2Exception: Indicates whether an individual event in a Lightning Experience event series has a recurrence pattern that’s different from the rest of the series, making it an exception.
Event.IsRecurrence2Exclusion: Indicates when updates to a Lightning Experience event series recurrence pattern have been made, but affect future event occurrences only. For past event occurrences, IsRecurrence2Exclusion is set to true, excluding past occurrences from the series recurrence pattern.
Event.IsReminderSet: Indicates whether the activity is a reminder (true) or not (false).
Event.Location: Contains the location of the event.
Event.OwnerId: Contains the ID of the user or public calendar who owns the event. Label is Assigned to ID.
Event.Recurrence2PatternStartDate: Indicates the date and time when the Lightning Experience event series begins. The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate.
Event.Recurrence2PatternText: Indicates the recurrence pattern for Lightning Experience event series. Recurrence2PatternText is implemented with RFC 5545 standard specifications for internet calendaring and scheduling. See Event Series section in this topic for usage examples.
Event.Recurrence2PatternTimeZone: Indicates the time zone in which the Lightning Experience event series was created or updated. This field uses standard Java TimeZone IDs. For example, America/Los_Angeles.
Event.Recurrence2PatternVersion: Indicates the standard specifications for Lightning Experience event series recurrence patterns. The only possible value is 1 (RFC 5545 v4 RRULE)—RFC 5545 is a standard set of specifications for internet calendaring and scheduling that IsRecurrence2 adheres to for series recurrence patterns. RFC 5545 specifications for series recurrence patterns are called rrules.
Event.RecurrenceActivityId: Not required on create. Contains the ID of the main record of the Salesforce Classic recurring event. Subsequent occurrences have the same value in this field.
Event.RecurrenceDayOfMonth: Indicates the day of the month on which the event repeats.
Event.RecurrenceDayOfWeekMask: Indicates the day or days of the week on which the Salesforce Classic recurring event repeats. This field contains a bitmask. The values are as follows: Sunday = 1 Monday = 2 Tuesday = 4 Wednesday = 8 Thursday = 16 Friday = 32 Saturday = 64 Multiple days are represented as the sum of their numerical values. For example, Tuesday and Thursday = 4 + 16 = 20.
Event.RecurrenceEndDateOnly: Indicates the last date on which the event repeats. For multiday Salesforce Classic recurring events, this is the day on which the last occurrence starts. This field is a date field with a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Don’t attempt to alter the timestamp to account for time zone differences.
Event.RecurrenceInstance: Indicates the frequency of the Salesforce Classic event’s recurrence. For example, 2nd or 3rd.
Event.RecurrenceInterval: Indicates the interval between Salesforce Classic recurring events.
Event.RecurrenceMonthOfYear: Indicates the month in which the Salesforce Classic recurring event repeats.
Event.RecurrenceStartDateTime: Indicates the date and time when the Salesforce Classic recurring event begins. The value must precede the RecurrenceEndDateOnly. The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate.
Event.RecurrenceTimeZoneSidKey: Indicates the time zone associated with a Salesforce Classic recurring event. For example, “UTC-8:00” for Pacific Standard Time.
Event.RecurrenceType: Indicates how often the Salesforce Classic event repeats. For example, daily, weekly, or every nth month (where “nth” is defined in RecurrenceInstance).
Event.ReminderDateTime: Represents the time when the reminder is scheduled to fire, if IsReminderSet is set to true. If IsReminderSet is set to false, then the user may have deselected the reminder checkbox in the Salesforce user interface, or the reminder has already fired at the time indicated by the value.
Event.ShowAs: Indicates how this event appears when another user views the calendar: Busy, Out of Office, or Free. Label is Show Time As.
Event.StartDateTime: Indicates the start date and time of the event. If the Event IsAllDayEvent flag is set to true (indicating that it is an all-day Event), then the event start date information is contained in the StartDateTime field. The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. If the Event IsAllDayEvent flag is set to false (indicating that it is not an all-day event), then the event start date information is contained in the StartDateTime field. The time portion is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. You need to translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. If this field has a value, then ActivityDate and ActivityDateTime must either be null or match the value of this field.
Event.Subject: The subject line of the event, such as Call, Email, or Meeting.
Event.WhatId: The WhatId represents nonhuman objects such as accounts, opportunities, campaigns, cases, or custom objects. WhatIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhatId is equivalent to the ID of a related object. The label is Related To ID.
Event.WhoId: The WhoId represents a human such as a lead or a contact. WhoIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhoId is equivalent to a contact’s ID or a lead’s ID. The label is Name ID. If Shared Activities is enabled, the value of this field is the ID of the related lead or primary contact. If you add, update, or remove the WhoId field, you might encounter problems with triggers, workflows, and data validation rules that are associated with the record. The label is Name ID. If the JunctionIdList field is used, all WhoIds are included in the relationship list. Beginning in API version 37.0, if the contact or lead ID in the WhoId field is not in the EventWhoIds list, no error occurs and the ID is added to the EventWhoIds as the primary WhoId. If WhoId is set to null, an arbitrary ID from the existing EventWhoIds list is promoted to the primary position.

Holiday.ActivityDate: If the Holiday IsAllDay flag is set to true (indicating that it is an all-day holiday), then the holiday due date information is contained in the ActivityDate field. This field is a date field with a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. The timestamp is not relevant, and you should not attempt to alter it to account for any time zone differences.
Holiday.EndTimeInMinutes: The end time of the holiday in minutes.
Holiday.IsAllDay: Indicates whether the duration of the holiday is all day (true) or not (false).
Holiday.IsRecurrence: Indicates whether the holiday is scheduled to repeat itself (true) or only occurs once (false). This is a read only field on update, but not on create. If this field value is true, then any recurrence fields associated with the given recurrence type must be populated.
Holiday.Name: The name of the holiday.
Holiday.RecurrenceDayOfMonth: The day of the month on which the holiday repeats.
Holiday.RecurrenceDayOfWeekMask: The day or days of the week on which the holiday repeats. This field contains a bitmask. For each day of the week, the values are as follows: Sunday = 1 Monday = 2 Tuesday = 4 Wednesday = 8 Thursday = 16 Friday = 32 Saturday = 64 Multiple days are represented as the sum of their numerical values. For example, Tuesday and Thursday = 4 + 16 = 20.
Holiday.RecurrenceEndDateOnly: The last date on which the holiday repeats. For multiday recurring events, this is the day on which the last occurrence starts.
Holiday.RecurrenceInstance: The frequency of the recurring holiday. For example, 2nd or 3rd.
Holiday.RecurrenceMonthOfYear: The month of the year on which the event repeats.
Holiday.RecurrenceStartDate: The date when the recurring holiday begins. Must be a date and time before RecurrenceEndDateOnly.
Holiday.RecurrenceType: Indicates how often the holiday repeats. For example, daily, weekly, or every Nth month (where “Nth” is defined in RecurrenceInstance).
Holiday.StartTimeInMinutes: The start time of the holiday in minutes.

Lead.Address: The compound form of the address. Read-only. For details on compound address fields, see Address Compound Fields.
Lead.AnnualRevenue: Annual revenue for the lead’s company.
Lead.Company: The lead’s company. If person account record types have been enabled, and if the value of Company is null, the lead converts to a person account.
Lead.ConvertedAccountId: Object reference ID that points to the account into which the lead converted.
Lead.ConvertedContactId: Object reference ID that points to the contact into which the lead converted.
Lead.ConvertedDate: Date on which this lead was converted.
Lead.ConvertedOpportunityId: Object reference ID that points to the opportunity into which the lead has been converted.
Lead.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.
Lead.EmailBouncedDate: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the lead bounced, the date and time of the bounce.
Lead.EmailBouncedReason: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the lead bounced, the reason for the bounce.
Lead.GeocodeAccuracy: Accuracy level of the geocode for the address. For details on geolocation compound fields, see .
Lead.IndividualId: ID of the data privacy record associated with this lead. This field is available if you enabled Data Protection and Privacy in Setup.
Lead.Industry: Industry in which the lead works.
Lead.IsConverted: Indicates whether the lead has been converted (true) or not (false). Label is Converted.
Lead.IsUnreadByOwner: If true, lead has been assigned, but not yet viewed. See Unread Leads for more information. Label is Unread By Owner.
Lead.Jigsaw: References the ID of a contact in Data.com. If a lead has a value in this field, it means that a contact was imported as a lead from Data.com. If the contact (converted to a lead) was not imported from Data.com, the field value is null. Label is Data.com Key.
Lead.LastActivityDate: Value is the most recent of either: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.
Lead.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Lead.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Lead.Latitude: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
Lead.Longitude: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
Lead.MasterRecordId: If this record was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that was kept. If this record was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null.When using Apex triggers to determine which record was deleted in a merge event, this field’s value is the ID of the record that remains in Trigger.old. In Trigger.new, the value is null.
Lead.Name: Concatenation of FirstName, MiddleName, LastName, and Suffix.
Lead.NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees at the lead’s company. Label is Employees.
Lead.PhotoUrl: Path to be combined with the URL of a Salesforce instance (Example: https://yourInstance.salesforce.com/) to generate a URL to request the social network profile image associated with the lead. Generated URL returns an HTTP redirect (code 302) to the social network profile image for the lead. Empty if Social Accounts and Contacts isn't enabled or if Social Accounts and Contacts has been disabled for the requesting user.
Lead.PostalCode: Postal code for the address of the lead. Label is Zip/Postal Code.
Lead.RecordTypeId: ID of the record type assigned to this object.
Lead.State: State for the address of the lead.
Lead.Status: Status code for this converted lead. Status codes are defined in Status and represented in the API by the LeadStatus object.
Lead.Street: Street number and name for the address of the lead.
Lead.Title: Title for the lead, such as CFO or CEO.

Location.CloseDate: Date the location closed or went out of service.
Location.ConstructionEndDate: Date construction ended at the location.
Location.ConstructionStartDate: Date construction began at the location.
Location.Description: A brief description of the location.
Location.IsInventoryLocation: Indicates whether the location stores parts.This field must be selected if you want to associate the location with product items.
Location.IsMobile: Indicates whether the location moves. For example, a truck or tool box.
Location.LastReferencedDate: The date when the location was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.
Location.LastViewedDate: The date the location was last viewed.
Location.LocationLevel: The location’s position in a location hierarchy. If the location has no parent or child locations, its level is 1. Locations that belong to a hierarchy have a level of 1 for the root location, 2 for the child locations of the root location, 3 for their children, and so forth.
Location.LocationType: Picklist of location types. It has no default values, so you must populate it before creating any location records.
Location.LogoId: A ContentAsset representing a logo for the location.
Location.Name: The name of the location. For example, Service Van #4.
Location.OpenDate: Date the location opened or came into service.
Location.ParentLocationId: The location’s parent location. For example, if vans are stored at a warehouse when not in service, the warehouse is the parent location.
Location.PossessionDate: The date the location was purchased.
Location.RemodelEndDate: Date when remodel construction ended at the location.
Location.RemodelStartDate: Date when remodel construction started at the location.
Location.RootLocationId: The top-level location in the location’s hierarchy.
Location.VisitorAddressId: Lookup to an account’s or client’s address.

Opportunity.AccountId: ID of the account associated with this opportunity.
Opportunity.Amount: Estimated total sale amount. For opportunities with products, the amount is the sum of the related products. Any attempt to update this field, if the record has products, will be ignored. The update call will not be rejected, and other fields will be updated as specified, but the Amount will be unchanged.
Opportunity.CampaignId: ID of a related Campaign. This field is defined only for those organizations that have the campaign feature Campaigns enabled. The User must have read access rights to the cross-referenced Campaign object in order to create or update that campaign into this field on the opportunity.
Opportunity.CloseDate: Date when the opportunity is expected to close.
Opportunity.ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity, set as the primary contact. Read-only field that is derived from the opportunity contact role, which is created at the same time the opportunity is created. This field can only be populated when it’s created, and can’t be updated.
Opportunity.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.
Opportunity.Fiscal: If fiscal years are not enabled, the name of the fiscal quarter or period in which the opportunity CloseDate falls. Value should be in YYY Q format, for example, '2006 1' for first quarter of 2006.
Opportunity.FiscalQuarter: Represents the fiscal quarter. Valid values are 1, 2, 3, or 4.
Opportunity.FiscalYear: Represents the fiscal year, for example, 2006.
Opportunity.ForecastCategory: Restricted picklist field. It is implied, but not directly controlled, by the StageName field. You can override this field to a different value than is implied by the StageName value. The values of this field are fixed enumerated values.
Opportunity.ForecastCategoryName: The name of the forecast category. It is implied, but not directly controlled, by the StageName field. You can override this field to a different value than is implied by the StageName value.
Opportunity.HasOpenActivity: Indicates whether an opportunity has an open event or task (true) or not (false).
Opportunity.HasOpportunityLineItem: Read-only field that indicates whether the opportunity has associated line items. A value of true means that Opportunity line items have been created for the opportunity. An opportunity can have opportunity line items only if the opportunity has a price book. The opportunity line items must correspond to PricebookEntry objects that are listed in the opportunity Pricebook2. However, you can insert opportunity line items on an opportunity that does not have an associated Pricebook2. For the first opportunity line item that you insert on an opportunity without a Pricebook2, the API automatically sets the Pricebook2Id field, if the opportunity line item corresponds to a PricebookEntry in an active Pricebook2 that has a CurrencyIsoCode field that matches the CurrencyIsoCode field of the opportunity. If the Pricebook2 is not active or the CurrencyIsoCode fields do not match, then the API returns an error. You can’t update the Pricebook2Id or PricebookId fields if opportunity line items exist on the Opportunity. You must delete the line items before attempting to update the PricebookId field.
Opportunity.HasOverdueTask: Indicates whether an opportunity has an overdue task (true) or not (false).
Opportunity.IsClosed: Directly controlled by StageName. You can query and filter on this field, but you can’t directly set it in a create, upsert, or update request. It can only be set via StageName. Label is Closed.
Opportunity.IsWon: Directly controlled by StageName. You can query and filter on this field, but you can’t directly set the value. It can only be set via StageName. Label is Won.
Opportunity.LastActivityDate: Value is one of the following, whichever is the most recent: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.
Opportunity.LastAmountChangedHistoryId: ID of the OpportunityHistory record that contains information about when the opportunity Amount field was last updated in Winter ’21 or later. Information includes the date and time of the change and the user who made the change.
Opportunity.LastCloseDateChangedHistoryId: ID of the OpportunityHistory record that contains information about when the opportunity Close Date field was last updated. Information includes the date and time of the change and the user who made the change.
Opportunity.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Opportunity.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Opportunity.LeadSource: Source of this opportunity, such as Advertisement or Trade Show.
Opportunity.Name: A name for this opportunity.
Opportunity.NextStep: Description of next task in closing opportunity.
Opportunity.OwnerId: ID of the User who has been assigned to work this opportunity.
Opportunity.Pricebook2Id: ID of a related Pricebook2 object. The Pricebook2Id field indicates which Pricebook2 applies to this opportunity. The Pricebook2Id field is defined only for those organizations that have products enabled as a feature. You can specify values for only one field (Pricebook2Id or PricebookId)—not both fields. For this reason, both fields are declared nillable.
Opportunity.Probability: Percentage of estimated confidence in closing the opportunity. It is implied, but not directly controlled, by the StageName field. You can override this field to a different value than what is implied by the StageName.
Opportunity.RecordTypeId: ID of the record type assigned to this object.
Opportunity.StageName: Current stage of this record. The StageName field controls several other fields on an opportunity. Each of the fields can be directly set or implied by changing the StageName field. In addition, the StageName field is a picklist, so it has additional members in the returned describeSObjectResult to indicate how it affects the other fields. To obtain the stage name values in the picklist, query the OpportunityStage object. If the StageName is updated, then the ForecastCategoryName, IsClosed, IsWon, and Probability are automatically updated based on the stage-category mapping.
Opportunity.Type: Type of opportunity. For example, Existing Business or New Business. Label is Opportunity Type.

OpportunityFieldHistory.Field: The name of the field that was changed.
OpportunityFieldHistory.NewValue: The new value of the field that was changed.
OpportunityFieldHistory.OldValue: The latest value of the field before it was changed.
OpportunityFieldHistory.OpportunityId: ID of the Opportunity. Label is Opportunity ID.

OpportunityHistory.CloseDate: Date when the opportunity is expected to close.
OpportunityHistory.ExpectedRevenue: Calculated revenue based on the Amount and Probability fields.
OpportunityHistory.ForecastCategory: Category that determines the column in which an opportunity is totaled in a forecast. Label is To ForecastCategory.
OpportunityHistory.PrevAmount: The value in the opportunity’s Amount field before the update of the opportunity.In OpportunityHistory records created before Winter ’21, the value is null.
OpportunityHistory.PrevCloseDate: The value in the opportunity’s Close Date field before the update of the opportunity.In OpportunityHistory records created before Winter ’21, the value is null.
OpportunityHistory.Probability: Percentage of estimated confidence in closing the opportunity.
OpportunityHistory.StageName: Name of the current stage of the opportunity (for example, Prospect or Proposal).

OpportunityLineItem.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.
OpportunityLineItem.Description: Text description of the opportunity line item.
OpportunityLineItem.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.
OpportunityLineItem.LastViewedDate: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.
OpportunityLineItem.ListPrice: Corresponds to the UnitPrice on the PricebookEntry that is associated with this line item, which can be in the standard price book or a custom price book. A client application can use this information to show whether the unit price (or sales price) of the line item differs from the price book entry list price.
OpportunityLineItem.Name: The opportunity line item name (known as “Opportunity Product” in the user interface).
OpportunityLineItem.PricebookEntryId: ID of the associated PricebookEntry. Exists only for those organizations that have Products enabled as a feature.
OpportunityLineItem.Product2Id: The ID of the related Product2 record. Use the PricebookEntryId field instead, specifying the ID of the PricebookEntry record.
OpportunityLineItem.ProductCode: It references the value in the ProductCode field of the related Product2 record.
OpportunityLineItem.Quantity: Product Quantity. If you specify Quantity without specifying the UnitPrice, the UnitPrice value will be adjusted to accommodate the new Quantity value, and the TotalPrice will be held constant. If you specify both Discount and Quantity, you must also specify either TotalPrice or UnitPrice so the system can determine which one to automatically adjust.
OpportunityLineItem.ServiceDate: Date when the product revenue will be recognized and the product quantity will be shipped. Opportunity Close Date—ServiceDate is ignored. Product Date—ServiceDate is used if not null. Schedule Date—ServiceDate is used if not null and there are no revenue schedules present for this line item, that is, there are no OpportunityLineItemSchedule records with a field Type value of Revenue that are children of this record.
OpportunityLineItem.SortOrder: Number indicating the sort order selected by the user. Client applications can use this to match the sort order in Salesforce.
OpportunityLineItem.TotalPrice: This field is available only for backward compatibility. It represents the total price of the OpportunityLineItem. If you do not specify UnitPrice, this field is required. If you specify Discount and Quantity, this field or UnitPrice is required. When updating these records, you can change either this value or the UnitPrice, but not both at the same time. This field is nillable, but you can’t set both TotalPrice and UnitPrice to null in the same update request.
OpportunityLineItem.UnitPrice: The unit price for the opportunity line item. In the Salesforce user interface, this field’s value is calculated by dividing the total price of the opportunity line item by the quantity listed for that line item. Label is Sales Price. This field or TotalPrice is required. You can’t specify both. If you specify Discount and Quantity, this field or TotalPrice is required.

OpportunityPartner.AccountToId: ID of the partner Account in the partner relationship.
OpportunityPartner.IsPrimary: Indicates whether the account is the opportunity’s primary partner (true) or not (false). Label is Primary.
OpportunityPartner.OpportunityId: ID of the Opportunity that is in the partner relationship.
OpportunityPartner.ReversePartnerId: ID of the account in a partner relationship.
OpportunityPartner.Role: The UserRole that the Account has on the Opportunity. For example, Reseller or Manufacturer.

Order.AccountId: ID of the Account associated with this order. Can only be updated when the order’s StatusCode value is Draft.
Order.ActivatedById: ID of the User who activated this order.
Order.ActivatedDate: Date and time when the order was activated.
Order.BillToContactId: ID of the contact that the order is billed to.
Order.BillingCity: City for the billing address for this order.
Order.BillingCountry: Country for the billing address for this order.
Order.BillingGeocodeAccuracy: Accuracy level of the geocode of the address.
Order.BillingLatitude: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.
Order.BillingLongitude: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.
Order.BillingPostalCode: Postal code for the billing address for this order.
Order.BillingState: State for the billing address for this order.
Order.BillingStreet: Street address for the billing address.
Order.CompanyAuthorizedById: ID of the user who authorized the account associated with the order.
Order.CompanyAuthorizedDate: The date on which your organization authorized the order.
Order.ContractId: ID of the contract associated with this order. Can only be updated when the order’s StatusCode value is Draft.
Order.CustomerAuthorizedById: ID of the contact who authorized the order.
Order.CustomerAuthorizedDate: Date on which the contact authorized the order.
Order.EffectiveDate: Date at which the order becomes effective. Label is Order Start Date.
Order.EndDate: Date at which the order ends. Label is Order End Date.
Order.IsReductionOrder: Determines whether an order is a reduction order. Label is Reduction Order.
Order.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Order.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Order.Name: Name for this order.
Order.OpportunityId: ID for the opportunity that’s associated with this order.
Order.OrderNumber: Order number assigned to this order (not the unique, system-generated ID assigned during creation).
Order.OrderReferenceNumber: Order reference number assigned to this order.
Order.OriginalOrderId: Optional. ID of the original order that a reduction order is reducing, if the reduction order is reducing a single order. Label is Original Order. Editable only if isReductionOrder is true. If the reduction order is reducing more than one order, leave blank.
Order.OwnerId: ID of the User or queue that owns this order.
Order.Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book associated with this order.
Order.ShipToContactId: ID of the contact that the order is shipped to.
Order.ShippingGeocodeAccuracy: Accuracy level of the geocode of the shipping address.
Order.ShippingLatitude: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address.
Order.ShippingLongitude: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
Order.ShippingPostalCode: Postal code of the shipping address.
Order.ShippingStreet: Street address of the shipping address.
Order.Status: Picklist of values that indicate order status. Each value is within one of two status categories defined in StatusCode. For example, the status picklist might contain Draft, Ready for Review, and Ready for Activation values with a StatusCode of Draft.
Order.StatusCode: The status category for the order. An order can be either Draft or Activated. Label is Status Category.
Order.TotalAmount: The total amount for the order products associated with this order.
Order.Type: If you want to show more information about your order, you can add custom values to the Type picklist. By default, the Type field doesn't perform any actions or show any values.

OrderHistory.Field: Name of the order field that was modified, or a special value to indicate some other modification to the order.
OrderHistory.NewValue: New value of the modified order field.
OrderHistory.OldValue: Previous value of the modified order field.
OrderHistory.OrderId: ID of the order associated with this record.

OrderItem.AvailableQuantity: Amount of an order product that is available to be reduced. Value must be greater than or equal to 0. An order product is reducible only if AvailableQuantity is greater than 0. Value is always 0 if the order product’s parent order is a reduction order.
OrderItem.EndDate: Optional. Last day the order product is available.
OrderItem.ListPrice: List price for the order product. Value is inherited from the associated PriceBookEntry upon order product creation.
OrderItem.OrderId: ID of the order that this order product is a child of.
OrderItem.OrderItemNumber: Automatically generated number that identifies the order product.
OrderItem.OriginalOrderItemId: Required if isReductionOrder on the parent order is true.
OrderItem.PricebookEntryId: ID of the associated PricebookEntry. This field must be specified when creating OrderItem records. It can’t be changed in an update.
OrderItem.Product2Id: ID of the Product2 associated with this OrderItem.
OrderItem.Quantity: Number of units of this order product.
OrderItem.ServiceDate: Start date for the order product.
OrderItem.TotalPrice: Total price for this order product. The calculations for this field’s value are different if Commerce Orders is enabled.
OrderItem.UnitPrice: Unit price for the order product.

Organization.City: Name of the city for the organization's address.
Organization.ComplianceBccEmail: Email address for compliance blind carbon copies.
Organization.Country: Name of the country for the organization's address.
Organization.DefaultAccountAccess: Represents the default access level for accounts, contracts, and assets.
Organization.DefaultPricebookAccess: Default access level for price books.
Organization.Division: The name of the division for this organization. This field is not related to the Division object.
Organization.FiscalYearStartMonth: Number that corresponds to the month that this organization's fiscal year starts.
Organization.IsSandbox: Indicates whether the current organization is a sandbox (true) or production (false) instance.
Organization.LanguageLocaleKey: The same as Language, the two-to-five character code which represents the language and locale ISO code. This controls the language for labels displayed in an application.
Organization.Latitude: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
Organization.Longitude: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
Organization.MonthlyPageViewsEntitlement: The number of page views allowed for the current calendar month for the sites in your organization.
Organization.MonthlyPageViewsUsed: The number of page views used in the current calendar month for the sites in your organization.
Organization.Name: The name of the organization.
Organization.OrganizationType: Edition of the organization, for example Enterprise Edition or Unlimited Edition.
Organization.PostalCode: Postal code for the address of the organization.
Organization.PreferencesRequireOpportunityProducts: Indicates whether opportunities require products (true) or not (false).
Organization.PreferencesTransactionSecurityPolicy: Indicates whether the Transaction Security feature has been enabled.
Organization.PrimaryContact: Name of the primary contact for the organization.
Organization.ReceivesAdminInfoEmails: Indicates whether the organization receives administrator emails (true) or not (false).
Organization.ReceivesInfoEmails: Indicates whether the organization receives informational email from Salesforce (true) or not (false).
Organization.SignupCountryIsoCode: The ISO country code specified by the user for a sign-up request.
Organization.State: State of the address of the organization.
Organization.TimeZoneSidKey: Identifies the default time zone of the organization.
Organization.TrialExpirationDate: The date that this organization's trial license expires.
Organization.UiSkin: The user interface theme selected for the organization.
Organization.UsesStartDateAsFiscalYearName: Indicates whether the calendar year when the fiscal year begins is referred to as the year of the company's fiscal year (true) or not (false). For example, if the fiscal year begins in February 2006, a true value means the fiscal year is FY2006, and a false value means the fiscal year is FY2007.
Organization.WebToCaseDefaultOrigin: The default value for the Case Origin field on cases submitted via Web-to-Case.

Partner.AccountFromId: Required if OpportunityId is null. ID of the main account in a partner relationship between two accounts.
Partner.AccountToId: ID of the Partner Account related to either an opportunity or an account.
Partner.IsPrimary: Valid for Opportunity Partners only. Indicates that the account is the primary partner for the opportunity. Only one account can be marked as primary for an opportunity. If you set this field to 1 (true) upon insert of a new opportunity partner, this field is automatically set to 0 (false) for any other primary partners for that opportunity. Label is Primary.
Partner.OpportunityId: Required if AccountFromId is null. ID of the opportunity in a partner relationship between an account and an opportunity. Specifying this field when creating a record creates an OpportunityPartner record. If you specify the AccountFromId field, you can’t also specify this field.
Partner.ReversePartnerId: ID of the account in a partner relationship.
Partner.Role: UserRole that the account has toward the related opportunity or account, such as consultant or distributor.

Period.EndDate: The last date of the fiscal period.
Period.FiscalYearSettingsId: The parent record for this period.
Period.FullyQualifiedLabel: Represents the period’s complete name in the UI. For example, “September FY 2016”.
Period.IsForecastPeriod: Indicates whether the period is associated with Collaborative Forecasts (true) or not (false).
Period.Number: If the labeling scheme of your fiscal year's quarters or months is numbered, this field indicates the relative number of the row.
Period.PeriodLabel: If the months in your fiscal year use custom names, then this field contains the appropriate name for rows of type Month.
Period.QuarterLabel: If the quarters in your fiscal year use custom names, then this field contains the appropriate name for rows of type Quarter.
Period.StartDate: The first date of the fiscal period.
Period.Type: Indicates whether the period is of type Month, Quarter, Week, or Year. Label is the field value.

Pricebook2.Description: Text description of the price book.
Pricebook2.IsActive: Indicates whether the price book is active (true) or not (false). Inactive price books are hidden in many areas in the user interface. You can change this field’s value as often as necessary. Label is Active.
Pricebook2.IsArchived: Indicates whether the price book has been archived (true) or not (false). This field is read only.
Pricebook2.IsDeleted: Indicates whether the price book has been moved to the Recycle Bin (true) or not (false). Label is Deleted.
Pricebook2.IsStandard: Indicates whether the price book is the standard price book for the org (true) or not (false). Every org has one standard price book—all other price books are custom price books.
Pricebook2.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.
Pricebook2.LastViewedDate: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.
Pricebook2.Name: Name of this object. This field is read-only for the standard price book. Label is Price Book Name.

Pricebook2History.Field: Name of the price book field that was modified, or a special value to indicate some other modification to the price book.
Pricebook2History.IsDeleted: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin (true) or not (false). This is a standard system field. Label is Deleted.
Pricebook2History.NewValue: New value of the modified price book field.
Pricebook2History.OldValue: Previous value of the modified price book field.
Pricebook2History.Pricebook2Id: ID of the Pricebook2 associated with this record.

PricebookEntry.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.
PricebookEntry.IsActive: Indicates whether this price book entry is active (true) or not (false). Although you can never delete PricebookEntry records, your client application can set this flag to false. Inactive PricebookEntry records are hidden in many areas in the user interface. You can change this flag on a PricebookEntry record as often as necessary.
PricebookEntry.IsArchived: Indicates whether the PricebookEntry has been archived (true) or not (false). This is set to true when the Product2 record it’s associated with is archived, or when the Pricebook2 record is archived. This field is read only. Label is Archived.
PricebookEntry.Name: Name of this PricebookEntry record. This read-only field references the value in the Name field of the Product2 record. Label is Product Name.
PricebookEntry.Pricebook2Id: ID of the Pricebook2 record with which this record is associated. This field must be specified when creating Pricebook2 records. It can’t be changed in an update.
PricebookEntry.Product2Id: ID of the Product2 record with which this record is associated. This field must be specified when creating Product2 records. It can’t be changed in an update.
PricebookEntry.ProductCode: Product code for this record. This read-only field references the value in the ProductCode field of the associated Product2 record.
PricebookEntry.UnitPrice: Unit price for this price book entry. You can specify a value only if UseStandardPrice is set to false. Label is List Price.
PricebookEntry.UseStandardPrice: Indicates whether this price book entry uses the standard price defined in the standard Pricebook2 record (true) or not (false). If set to true, then the UnitPrice field is read-only, and the value will be the same as the UnitPrice value in the corresponding PricebookEntry in the standard price book (that is, the PricebookEntry record whose Pricebook2Id refers to the standard price book and whose Product2Id and CurrencyIsoCode are the same as this record). For PricebookEntry records associated with the standard Pricebook2 record, this field must be set to true.

Product2.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the org.
Product2.Description: A text description of this record. Label is Product Description.
Product2.DisplayUrl: URL leading to a specific version of a record in the linked external data source.
Product2.ExternalDataSourceId: ID of the related external data source.
Product2.ExternalId: The unique identifier of a record in the linked external data source. For example, ID #123.
Product2.Family: Name of the product family associated with this record. Product families are configured as picklists in the user interface. To obtain a list of valid values, call describeSObjects() and process the DescribeSObjectResult for the values associated with the Family field. Label is Product Family.
Product2.IsActive: Indicates whether this record is active (true) or not (false). Inactive Product2 records are hidden in many areas in the user interface. You can change the IsActive flag on a Product2 object as often as necessary. Label is Active.
Product2.IsArchived: Describes whether the product is archived. The default value is false.
Product2.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Product2.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Product2.Name: Default name of this record. Label is Product Name.
Product2.ProductCode: Default product code for this record. Your org defines the product code naming pattern.
Product2.QuantityUnitOfMeasure: Unit of the product; for example, kilograms, liters, or cases. This field comes with only one value, Each, so consider creating your own. The QuantityUnitOfMeasure field on ProductItem inherits this field’s values.
Product2.StockKeepingUnit: The SKU for the product. Use in tandem with or instead of the ProductCode field. For example, you can track the manufacturer’s identifying code in the Product Code field and assign the product a SKU when you resell it.

RecordType.DeveloperName: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. Label is Record Type Name.
RecordType.IsActive: Indicates whether this record is active (true) or not (false). Only active record types can be applied to records. Label is Active.
RecordType.Name: Label of the record type in the user interface. Label is Record Type Label.
RecordType.SobjectType: Object to which this record type applies, including custom objects.

ServiceContract.AccountId: ID of the account associated with the service contract.
