ServiceContract.ActivationDate: The initial day the service contract went into effect (whereas StartDate may include a renewal date).
ServiceContract.ApprovalStatus: Approval status of the service contract.
ServiceContract.BillingLatitude: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.
ServiceContract.BillingLongitude: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.
ServiceContract.BillingPostalCode: Postal code for the billing address.
ServiceContract.BillingState: State name for the billing address.
ServiceContract.BillingStreet: Street address for the billing address.
ServiceContract.ContactId: ID of the Contact associated with the service contract. Must be a valid ID.
ServiceContract.ContractNumber: Unique number automatically assigned to the service contract.
ServiceContract.Discount: The last day the service contract is in effect.
ServiceContract.EndDate: The last day the service contract is in effect.
ServiceContract.GrandTotal: Total price of the service contract plus shipping and taxes.
ServiceContract.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
ServiceContract.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
ServiceContract.LineItemCount: Number of ContractLineItem records associated with the service contract.
ServiceContract.Name: Name of the service contract.
ServiceContract.OwnerId: The ID of the user who currently owns the service contract.
ServiceContract.ParentServiceContractId: The service contract’s parent service contract, if it has one.
ServiceContract.Pricebook2Id: ID of the Pricebook2 associated with the service contract. Must be a valid ID.
ServiceContract.RootServiceContractId: The top-level service contract in a service contract hierarchy. Depending on where a service contract lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent.
ServiceContract.ShippingLatitude: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address.
ServiceContract.ShippingLongitude: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
ServiceContract.ShippingState: State name of the shipping address.
ServiceContract.ShippingStreet: The street address of the shipping address.
ServiceContract.SpecialTerms: Any terms specifically agreed to and tracked in the service contract.
ServiceContract.StartDate: The first day the service contract is in effect.
ServiceContract.Status: The status of the service contract, such as Inactive.
ServiceContract.Subtotal: Total of the service contract line items (products) before discounts, taxes, and shipping are applied.
ServiceContract.Tax: Total taxes for the service contract.
ServiceContract.Term: Number of months that the service contract is valid.
ServiceContract.TotalPrice: Total of the contract line items (products) after discounts and before taxes and shipping.

Solution.IsHtml: Indicates whether the Solution is an HTML solution (true) or not (false).
Solution.IsPublished: Indicates whether the Solution has been published (true) or not (false). A solution’s published state does not affect how it can be used, or whether you can query, update, or delete it. Label is Public.Prior to Spring ‘14, the label was Visible in Self-Service Portal.
Solution.IsPublishedInPublicKb: Indicates whether the Solution has been published as a Public Solution (true) or not (false). Label is Visible in Public Knowledge Base. This field only applies to solutions, not articles in the public knowledge base.
Solution.IsReviewed: Indicates whether the Solution has been reviewed (true) or not (false). This flag can only be set indirectly via the Status picklist. Each predefined Status value implies an IsReviewed value. Label is Reviewed.
Solution.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.
Solution.LastViewedDate: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.
Solution.OwnerId: ID of the User who owns the Solution.
Solution.SolutionName: If a client application creates a new Solution and a value for this field is unspecified, a hyphen (-), the default value for this field, is used. Label is Title.
Solution.SolutionNote: The details of the Solution record. Label is Solution Details.If you have HTML Solutions enabled, any HTML tags used in this field are verified before the object is created or updated. If invalid HTML is entered, an error is thrown.
Solution.SolutionNumber: An identifying number that is assigned automatically when a solution is created. It can’t be set directly, and it can’t be modified.
Solution.Status: The status of the solution. Directly controls the IsReviewed value. To obtain the status values in the picklist, a client application can query the SolutionStatus.
Solution.TimesUsed: Number of times this solution has been used. Label is Num Related Case.

Task.AccountId: Represents the ID of the related Account. The AccountId is determined as follows. If the value of WhatId is any of the following objects, then Salesforce uses that object’s AccountId. Account Opportunity Contract Custom object that is a child of Account If the value of the WhatIdfield is any other object, and the value of the WhoId field is a Contact object, then Salesforce uses that contact’s AccountId. (If your organization uses Shared Activities, then Salesforce uses the AccountId of the primary contact.) Otherwise, Salesforce sets the value of the AccountId field to null. For information on IDs, see ID Field Type.
Task.ActivityDate: Represents the due date of the task. This field has a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. The timestamp is not relevant; do not attempt to alter it to accommodate time zone differences. Label is Due Date.This field can’t be set or updated for a recurring task (IsRecurrence is true).
Task.CallDisposition: Represents the result of a given call.
Task.CallDurationInSeconds: Duration of the call in seconds.
Task.CallType: The type of call being answered: Inbound, Internal, or Outbound.
Task.CompletedDateTime: The date and time the task was saved with a Closed status. For insert, if the task is saved with a Closed status the field is set. If the task is saved with an Open status the field is set to NULL. For update, if the task is saved with a new Closed status, the field is reset. If the task is saved with a new non-closed status, the field is reset to NULL. If the task is saved with the same closed status (that is, unchanged) there is no change to the field. The status is a dynamic enum. If the Closed mapping is changed it won’t cause an update of existing tasks. Only new insert/update operations are affected.
Task.Description: Contains a text description of the task.
Task.IsArchived: Indicates whether the event has been archived.
Task.IsClosed: Indicates whether the task has been completed (true) or not (false). Is only set indirectly via the Status picklist. Label is Closed.
Task.IsHighPriority: Indicates a high-priority task. This field is derived from the Priority field.
Task.IsRecurrence: Indicates whether the task is scheduled to repeat itself (true) or only occurs once (false). If this field value is true, then RecurrenceStartDateOnly, RecurrenceEndDateOnly, RecurrenceType, and any recurrence fields associated with the given recurrence type must be populated. See Recurring Tasks.
Task.IsReminderSet: Indicates whether a popup reminder has been set for the task (true) or not (false).
Task.OwnerId: ID of the User or Group who owns the record. Label is Assigned To ID. This field accepts Groups of type Queue only. In the user interface, Group IDs correspond with the queue’s list view names.
Task.Priority: Indicates the importance or urgency of a task, such as high or low.
Task.RecurrenceActivityId: Not required on create. ID of the main record of the recurring task. Subsequent occurrences have the same value in this field.
Task.RecurrenceDayOfMonth: The day of the month in which the task repeats.
Task.RecurrenceDayOfWeekMask: The day or days of the week on which the task repeats. This field contains a bitmask. The values are as follows: Sunday = 1 Monday = 2 Tuesday = 4 Wednesday = 8 Thursday = 16 Friday = 32 Saturday = 64 Multiple days are represented as the sum of their numerical values. For example, Tuesday and Thursday = 4 + 16 = 20.
Task.RecurrenceEndDateOnly: The last date on which the task repeats. This field has a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. The timestamp is not relevant; do not attempt to alter it to accommodate time zone differences.
Task.RecurrenceInstance: The frequency of the recurring task.
Task.RecurrenceMonthOfYear: The month of the year in which the task repeats.
Task.RecurrenceRegeneratedType: Represents what triggers a repeating task to repeat. Add this field to a page layout together with the RecurrenceInterval field, which determines the number of days between the triggering date (due date or close date) and the due date of the next repeating task in the series. Label is Repeat This Task.
Task.RecurrenceStartDateOnly: The date when the recurring task begins. Must be a date and time before RecurrenceEndDateOnly.
Task.RecurrenceTimeZoneSidKey: The time zone associated with the recurring task. For example, “UTC-8:00” for Pacific Standard Time.
Task.RecurrenceType: Indicates how often the task repeats. For example, daily, weekly, or every nth month (where “nth” is defined in RecurrenceInstance).
Task.ReminderDateTime: Represents the time when the reminder is scheduled to fire, if IsReminderSet is set to true. If IsReminderSet is set to false, then the user may have deselected the reminder checkbox in the Salesforce user interface, or the reminder has already fired at the time indicated by the value.
Task.Status: The status of the task, such as In Progress or Completed. Each predefined Status field implies a value for the IsClosed flag. To obtain picklist values, query the TaskStatus object.This field can’t be updated for recurring tasks (IsRecurrence is true).
Task.Subject: The subject line of the task.
Task.TaskSubtype: Provides standard subtypes to facilitate creating and searching for specific task subtypes.
Task.WhatId: The WhatId represents nonhuman objects such as accounts, opportunities, campaigns, cases, or custom objects. The label is Related To ID.
Task.WhoId: The WhoId represents a human such as a lead or a contact. The label is Name ID.

User.AboutMe: Information about the user, such as areas of interest or skills. This field is available even if Chatter is disabled.
User.AccountId: ID of the Account associated with a Customer Portal user. This field is null for Salesforce users.
User.Alias: The user’s alias. For example, jsmith.
User.BadgeText: The Experience Cloud site role, displayed on the user profile page just below the user name.
User.BannerPhotoUrl: The URL for the user's banner photo.
User.CallCenterId: If Salesforce CRM Call Center is enabled, represents the call center to which this user is assigned.
User.City: The city associated with the user.
User.CommunityNickname: Name used to identify this user in the Experience Cloud site.
User.CompanyName: The name of the user’s company.
User.ContactId: ID of the Contact associated with this account. The contact must have a value in the AccountId field or an error occurs.
User.Country: The country associated with the user.
User.DefaultCurrencyIsoCode: The user's default currency setting for new records. For example, a user in France could have a DefaultCurrencyIsoCode set to Euros, and that would be their default currency in the application. Only applicable for organizations that use multiple currencies.
User.DefaultGroupNotificationFrequency: The default frequency for sending the user's Chatter group email notifications when the user joins groups.
User.DelegatedApproverId: Id of the user who is a delegated approver for this user.
User.Department: The company department associated with the user.
User.DigestFrequency: The frequency at which the system sends the user’s Chatter personal email digest.
User.Division: The division associated with this user, similar to Department and unrelated to DefaultDivision.
User.EmailEncodingKey: The email encoding for the user, such as ISO-8859-1 or UTF-8.
User.EmailPreferencesAutoBcc: Determines whether the user receives copies of sent emails. This option applies only if compliance BCC emails are not enabled.
User.FederationIdentifier: Indicates the value that must be listed in the Subject element of a Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) IDP certificate to authenticate the user for a client application using single sign-on. This value must be specified if the SAML User ID Type is Assertion contains Federation ID from the User record. Otherwise, this field can’t be edited.
User.ForecastEnabled: Indicates whether the user is enabled as a forecast manager (true) or not (false). Forecast managers see forecast rollups from users below them in the forecast hierarchy.
User.FullPhotoUrl: The URL for the user's profile photo. This field is available even if Chatter is disabled. The URL is updated every time a photo is uploaded and reflects the most recent photo. If a newer photo has been uploaded, the URL returned for an older photo is not guaranteed to return a photo. Query this field for the URL of the most recent photo.
User.GeocodeAccuracy: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. A geocoding service typically provides this value based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates.
User.IndividualId: ID of the data privacy record associated with this user. This field is available if Data Protection and Privacy is enabled.
User.IsActive: Indicates whether the user has access to log in (true) or not (false). You can modify a User's active status from the user interface or via the API.
User.IsProfilePhotoActive: Indicates whether a user has a profile photo (true) or not (false).
User.LanguageLocaleKey: The user’s language, such as “French” or “Chinese (Traditional).” Label is Language.
User.LastLoginDate: The date and time when the user last successfully logged in. This value is updated if 60 seconds have elapsed since the user’s last login.
User.LastReferencedDate: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.
User.LastViewedDate: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.
User.Latitude: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
User.LocaleSidKey: This field is a restricted picklist field. The value of the field affects formatting and parsing of values, especially numeric values, in the user interface. The field values are named according to the language, and country if necessary, using two-letter ISO codes. The set of names is based on the ISO standard.
User.Longitude: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.
User.ManagerId: The Id of the user who manages this user.
User.MediumBannerPhotoUrl: The URL for the medium-sized user profile banner photo.
User.MobilePhone: The user’s mobile or cellular phone number.
User.Name: Concatenation of FirstName and LastName.
User.OfflineTrialExpirationDate: The date and time when the user’s Connect Offline trial expires.
User.PostalCode: The user’s postal or ZIP code. Label is Zip/Postal Code.
User.ProfileId: ID of the user’s Profile. Use this value to cache metadata based on profile. In earlier releases, this was RoleId.
User.ReceivesAdminInfoEmails: Indicates whether the user receives email for administrators from Salesforce (true) or not (false).
User.ReceivesInfoEmails: Indicates whether the user receives informational email from Salesforce (true) or not (false).
User.SenderEmail: The email address used as the From address when the user sends emails.
User.SenderName: The name used as the email sender when the user sends emails.
User.Signature: The signature text added to emails.
User.SmallBannerPhotoUrl: The URL for the small user profile banner photo.
User.SmallPhotoUrl: The URL for a thumbnail of the user's profile photo. This field is available even if Chatter is disabled. The URL is updated every time a photo is uploaded and reflects the most recent photo. If a newer photo has been uploaded, the URL returned for an older photo is not guaranteed to return a photo. Query this field for the URL of the most recent photo.
User.State: The state associated with the User.
User.Street: The street address associated with the User.
User.TimeZoneSidKey: This field is a restricted picklist field. A User time zone affects the offset used when displaying or entering times in the user interface. However, the API does not use a User time zone when querying or setting values. Values for this field are named using region and key city, according to ISO standards.
User.Title: The user’s business title, such as “Vice President.”
User.UserRoleId: ID of the user’s UserRole. Label is Role ID.
User.Username: Contains the name that a user enters to log in to the API or the user interface. The value for this field must be in the form of an email address. It must also be unique across all organizations.

WorkOrder.AccountId: The account associated with the work order.
WorkOrder.Address: The compound form of the address where the work order is completed.
WorkOrder.AssetId: The asset associated with the work order.
WorkOrder.BusinessHoursId: The business hours associated with the work order.
WorkOrder.CaseId: The case associated with the work order.
WorkOrder.City: The city where the work order is completed.
WorkOrder.ContactId: The contact associated with the work order.
WorkOrder.Country: The country where the work order is completed.
WorkOrder.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization. The label in the user interface is Currency ISO Code.
WorkOrder.Description: The description of the work order. Try to include the steps needed to change the work order’s status to Completed.
WorkOrder.Discount: Read only. The weighted average of the discounts on all line items in the work order. It can be any positive number up to 100.
WorkOrder.Duration: The estimated time required to complete the work order. Specify the duration unit in the Duration Type field.Work order duration and work order line item duration are independent of each other. If you want work order duration to automatically show the sum of the work order line items’ duration, replace the Duration field on work orders with a custom roll-up summary field.
WorkOrder.DurationInMinutes: The estimated duration in minutes. For internal use only.
WorkOrder.DurationType: The unit of the duration: Minutes or Hours.
WorkOrder.EndDate: The date when the work order is completed. This field is blank unless you set up an Apex trigger or quick action to populate it. For example, you can create a quick action that sets the EndDate to 365 days after the StartDate.
WorkOrder.EntitlementId: The entitlement associated with the work order.
WorkOrder.GeocodeAccuracy: Accuracy level of the geocode for the address.
WorkOrder.GrandTotal: Read only. The total price of the work order with tax added.
WorkOrder.IsClosed: Indicates whether the work order is closed (true) or open (false). Use this field to report on closed versus open work orders.
WorkOrder.IsStopped: Indicates whether a milestone is paused (true) or counting down (false).
WorkOrder.LastReferencedDate: The date when the work order was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.
WorkOrder.LastViewedDate: The date when the work order was last viewed.
WorkOrder.Latitude: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the work order is completed.
WorkOrder.LineItemCount: The number of work order line items in the work order. Its label in the user interface is Line Items.
WorkOrder.LocationId: The location associated with the work order. For example, a work site.
WorkOrder.Longitude: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the work order is completed.
WorkOrder.MilestoneStatus: Indicates the status of a milestone. This field is visible if an entitlement process is applied to a work order.
WorkOrder.ParentWorkOrderId: The work order’s parent work order, if it has one.Create a custom report to view a work order’s child work orders.
WorkOrder.PostalCode: The postal code where the work order is completed.
WorkOrder.Pricebook2Id: The price book associated with the work order. Adding a price book to the work order lets you assign different price book entries to the work order’s line items.
WorkOrder.Priority: The priority of the work order. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: Low, Medium, High, Critical.
WorkOrder.RootWorkOrderId: The top-level work order in a work order hierarchy. Depending on where a work order lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent.View a work order’s child work order in the Child Work Orders related list.
WorkOrder.ServiceAppointmentCount: The number of service appointments on the work order.
WorkOrder.ServiceContractId: The service contract associated with the work order.
WorkOrder.SlaExitDate: The time that the work order exits the entitlement process.
WorkOrder.SlaStartDate: The time that the work order enters the entitlement process. You can update or reset the time if you have “Edit” permission on work orders.
WorkOrder.StartDate: The date when the work order goes into effect. This field is blank unless you set up an Apex trigger or quick action to populate it. For example, you can create a quick action that sets the StartDate to the date when the Status changes to In Progress.
WorkOrder.State: The state where the work order is completed.
WorkOrder.Status: The status of the work order.
WorkOrder.StatusCategory: The category that each Status value falls into.
WorkOrder.StopStartDate: Indicates when the milestone was paused. The label in the user interface is Stopped Since.
WorkOrder.Street: The street number and name where the work order is completed.
WorkOrder.Subject: The subject of the work order. Try to describe the nature and purpose of the job to be completed.
WorkOrder.Subtotal: Read only. The total of the work order line items’ subtotals before discounts and taxes are applied.
WorkOrder.Tax: The total tax on the work order. You can enter a number with or without the currency symbol and use up to two decimal places. For example, in a work order whose total price is $100, enter $10 to apply a 10% tax.
WorkOrder.TotalPrice: Read only. The total of the work order line items’ prices. This value has discounts applied but not tax.
WorkOrder.WorkOrderNumber: An eight-digit, auto-generated number that identifies the work order.

WorkOrderHistory.Field: The name of the field that was changed.
WorkOrderHistory.NewValue: The new value of the field that was changed.
WorkOrderHistory.OldValue: The value of the field before it was changed.
WorkOrderHistory.WorkOrderId: ID of the work order being tracked. The history is displayed on the detail page for this record.

WorkOrderLineItem.Address: The compound form of the address where the line item is completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.AssetId: The asset associated with the work order line item. The asset is not automatically inherited from the parent work order.
WorkOrderLineItem.City: The city where the line item is completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.Country: The country where the line item is completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.CurrencyIsoCode: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization. The label in the user interface is Currency ISO Code.
WorkOrderLineItem.Description: The description of the work order line item. Try to describe the steps needed to mark the line item Completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.Discount: The percent discount to apply to the line item. You can enter a number with or without the percent symbol, and you can use up to two decimal places.
WorkOrderLineItem.Duration: The estimated time required to complete the line item. Specify the duration unit in the Duration Type field.Work order duration and work order line item duration are independent of each other. If you want work order duration to automatically show the sum of the work order line items’ duration, replace the Duration field on work orders with a custom roll-up summary field.
WorkOrderLineItem.DurationInMinutes: The estimated duration in minutes. For internal use only.
WorkOrderLineItem.DurationType: The unit of the duration: Minutes or Hours.
WorkOrderLineItem.EndDate: The date on which the line item is completed. This field is blank unless you set up an Apex trigger or quick action to populate it. For example, you can create a quick action that sets the EndDate to 365 days after the StartDate.
WorkOrderLineItem.GeocodeAccuracy: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. Usually provided by a geocoding service based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates.
WorkOrderLineItem.IsClosed: Indicates whether the line item has been closed. Changing the line item’s status to Closed causes this checkbox to be selected in the user interface (sets IsClosed to true).Use this field to report on closed versus open work order line items.
WorkOrderLineItem.LastReferencedDate: The date when the line item was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.
WorkOrderLineItem.LastViewedDate: The date when the line item was last viewed.
WorkOrderLineItem.Latitude: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the line item is completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.LineItemNumber: An auto-generated number that identifies the work order line item. Each work order’s line items start at 1.
WorkOrderLineItem.ListPrice: The price of the line item (product) as listed in its corresponding price book entry. If a price book entry isn’t specified, the list price defaults to zero.
WorkOrderLineItem.LocationId: A location associated with the work order line item. For example, a work site.
WorkOrderLineItem.Longitude: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the line item is completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.OrderId: The order associated with the line item. For example, you may need to order replacement parts before you can complete the line item.
WorkOrderLineItem.ParentWorkOrderLineItemId: The line item’s parent work order line item, if it has one.Create a custom report to view a line item’s child line items.
WorkOrderLineItem.PostalCode: The postal code where the line item is completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.PricebookEntryId: The price book entry (product) associated with the line item. The label in the user interface is Product. This field’s lookup search only returns products that are included in the work order’s price book.
WorkOrderLineItem.Priority: The priority of the line item. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: Low Medium High Critical
WorkOrderLineItem.Product2Id: The product associated with the price book entry. This field is not available in the user interface. For best results, use the PricebookEntryId field in any custom code or layouts.
WorkOrderLineItem.Quantity: Number of units of the line item included in the associated work order.
WorkOrderLineItem.RootWorkOrderLineItemId: The top-level line item in a work order line item hierarchy. Depending on where a line item lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent.View a line item’s child line items in the Child Work Order Line Items related list.
WorkOrderLineItem.ServiceAppointmentCount: The number of service appointments on the work order line item.
WorkOrderLineItem.StartDate: The date on which the line item goes into effect. This field is blank unless you set up an Apex trigger or quick action to populate it. For example, you can create a quick action that sets the StartDate to the date when the Status changes to In Progress.
WorkOrderLineItem.State: The state where the line item is completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.Status: The status of the line item. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: New—Line item was created, but there hasn’t yet been any activity. In Progress—Work has begun. On Hold—Work is paused. Completed—Work is complete. Cannot Complete—Work could not be completed. Closed—All work and associated activity is complete. Canceled—Work is canceled, typically before any work began.
WorkOrderLineItem.StatusCategory: The category that each Status value falls into.
WorkOrderLineItem.Street: The street number and name where the line item is completed.
WorkOrderLineItem.Subject: A word or phrase describing the line item.
WorkOrderLineItem.Subtotal: The line item’s unit price multiplied by the quantity.
WorkOrderLineItem.TotalPrice: Read only. The line item’s subtotal with discounts applied.
WorkOrderLineItem.UnitPrice: The unit price for a work order line item is the line item’s list price from the price book.
WorkOrderLineItem.WorkOrderId: The line item’s parent work order.

WorkOrderLineItemHistory.Field: The name of the field that was changed.
WorkOrderLineItemHistory.NewValue: The new value of the field that was changed.
WorkOrderLineItemHistory.OldValue: The value of the field before it was changed.
WorkOrderLineItemHistory.WorkOrderLineItemId: ID of the work order line item being tracked. The history is displayed on the detail page for this record.
